column2: GEORGIA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. This sign means:
column4: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column6: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column8: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.

column2: 2. Regulatory signs are:
3. This road sign means:
4. This road sign means:
5. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are not allowed to park here.
column6: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column8: you must display a special permit in order to park here.

column2: 6. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the right.
column6: slow down and keep well to the left.
column8: increase their speed and keep well to the right.

column2: 7. This sign indicates:
8. This sign means:
column6: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 9. This signal means:
10. This road sign means:
column8: Do not use your brakes in this area

column2: 11. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: prepare to leave the lane safely.
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 12. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
13. This road sign means:
14. This road sign means:
15. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
16. Regulation signs normally are:
17. Green and white signs:
column4: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column6: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column8: give information about directions and distances.

column2: 18. This warning sign:
column4: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column6: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column8: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.

column2: 19. Most signs used in street work areas are:
20. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 21. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column8: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 22. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
23. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
24. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.

column2: 25. Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving ability is permitted:
column4: if it is prescribed by a physician.

column2: 26. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.

column2: 27. A solid yellow line on your side of the center line means:
28. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column6: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column8: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 29. Unless otherwise posted, the maximum speed limit on a rural interstate highway is:
30. Never make a U-turn from:
column6: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 31. Drivers may legally block an intersection:
column4: only after entering the intersection on a green light.

column2: 32. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column6: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column8: The bus is about to stop.

column2: 33. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Open the side window so you can see.

column2: 34. A red arrow on a traffic light means:
column4: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
column6: You may turn in in the direction of the arrow after coming to a complete stop.
column8: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.

column2: 35. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column6: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column8: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 36. If a tire suddenly blows out while you are driving, you should:
column6: slow down gradually and brake lightly.

column2: 37. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Eating before or while you drink.
column8: Not drinking over a period of time.

column2: 38. The road is the most slippery:
column6: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 39. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column6: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column8: make a U-turn into the two-way road.

column2: 40. Which statement about taking medications and driving is true?
column4: Prescribed drugs are safe to take at any time.
column6: Cold medications can make a person drowsy.
column8: Over the counter drugs do not affect driving ability.
